ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: less than 5 hours unless there was a homework due
8hrs
None
1 to 2 when homeworks were due
About 2 hours~ teaching myslef basic epidemiology concepts (I haven't taken the basic Epi course).

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great, a good survey course
Good material, interesting lectures, good assignments. Not too heavy work load
Strengths: variety of topics covered was interestingWeaknesses: too much focus on cancer and not enough on other disease outcomes, need to list Epi I as a prerequisite!

strength: This course was arranged very well and covered a wide range of topics which were under debate in the public. Besides, I do like writing critiques as homeworks/tests in this course, which benefited me a lot in reading through literatures. Overall, I enjoyed this course a lot.
Good foundation of environmental epidemiology.

Tong's goal for this class is to get you to think critically about environmental epidemiology studies, and he does that effectively. The class is extremely low maintenance - no reading, 5 article critiques (including the midterm and final). With all of the guest lectures, this class sometimes felt like a second EHS seminar. I took the class concurrently with Epi 1 and had no problems with it.
Very great class, Dr. Zheng clarified many epi topics and a understanding way. Focused on many articles and learned how to critically read them.

strengths - covered objectives welli feel like i have a better handle of critically reading scientific papersweaknesses - the guest lecturers were too detailed and i tended to get very bored listening to them (the only exception was the lecture on circadian rhythms)we didn't get a lecture on indoor air pollution like the syllabus said

Great class. I learned a lot, and it actually really helped with the principles of epidemiology class a great deal. I feel like I understand a lot more about environmental epidemiology, and environmental health in general.

Strengths of the course: you examine current environmental epidemiological studies that are interesting and the guest speakers are working on some interesting topics (i.e. cancer registry, benzene exposure)Weaknesses:The beginning of the course reviews basic epidemiology,but the presenation of the information is very disconnected and confusing.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Tong is very approachable and knowledgable.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Very engaging and positive lecturer
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Great enthusiasm for teaching, but I often had difficulty understanding explanations and whether or not my first assumption was correct.

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  The primary instructor (Dr. Zheng) is very passionate and organized in teaching this course. He is very successful in delivering those key concepts concisely and clear. Also, he walked us through a lot of related cases, which helped a lot for me to understand how to apply those concepts in the real cases. Overall, I enjoyed Dr. Zheng's teaching a lot.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Excellent. Clear, cogent, dynamic lecturer and well organized. Nice supplementation of materials with outside lecturers. Magic Tricks!

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Tong is very enthusiastic and dedicated to making sure his students understand the material. His lectures can get a bit repetitive, but he gets his points across and livens things up with some magic tricks when the class looks bored. He is friendly and approachable.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Tong is very dynamic and animated.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Excellent. Helped me understand many epi concepts and how to critically read a epi article.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  very enthusiasticgood feedback on the homeworksgenuinely cares about teaching

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Dr. Zheng is a great instructor. He made the material so interesting and always made sure that we understood the material. He was sensitive to our concerns and made the subject matter interesting with jokes and magic tricks--terrific!
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Wonderful! He really seems to enjoy teaching this class, and was eager for us to learn a great deal

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Strengths:Genuinely concerned about students grasping concepts.Weakness:Uses powerpoints often, however the powerpoints are very hard to follow when trying to understand new concepts.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: She was great and very nice
TA was not an integral part of the teaching of the course.
The TA is very responsible in uploading all the study materials on time. She always arrive several minutes earlier in class and is willing to help you all the time.
Xuesong was great!
Xuesong was our TA, she was great! I never had to ask her for help but if I had I'm sure she would have been available!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good course, would recommend
Good course with solid grounding in methods and content. Worthwhile to take.
I would recommend this course to a student who has experience in epidemiology or has taken Epi I.
Yeah, I would definitely recommend it to other students. You can definitely learn something interesting and it is not horribly hard.
Required for EHS students, but probably not worthtaking for non-EHS students who already have a good understanding of epidemiology. Very little work required.
Tong is a good lecturer, and the guest lecturers that he brought in were very interesting, but the assignments were boring and tough to get through.
Great class. Not a lot of work.
Yes, if they have an interest in occupational and environmental epidemiology
This class is a really great way to learn about environmental health and epidemiology. I would absolutely recommend this class, especially because of Dr. Zheng.
This course analyzes epidemiological studies that were created to understand the relationship between the environment and human health.
